description: Updates an event source mapping. You can change the function that AWS Lambda invokes, or pause invocation and resume later from the same location.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Changing the event source mapping can be used to invoke a function via HTTP/S requests, which aligns with utilizing web protocols for execution.
Adversaries can use this API call to set up or alter scheduled tasks or jobs, such as Lambda functions, to achieve persistence by ensuring repeated or delayed execution.
Adversaries can pause the invocation of a Lambda function to impair or disable security tools or monitoring functions, thereby evading detection or preventing logging.
Adversaries can obfuscate their actions by frequently changing the event source mapping, making it harder to trace the function invocations.
Changing the event source mapping can also be used to manipulate which account or function is invoked, potentially changing the permissions context.
Updating the event source mapping involves modifying the cloud infrastructure to change how functions are executed, which is a form of altering cloud resources for persistence or evasion.
